column2: Disables random popup province/political events that fire every now and then relating to issues such as immigration, mining efficiency, safaris, etc., in order to slightly boost performance and greatly increase the speed of playthroughs at the cost of some random flavor.

Re-enables random popup province/political events that fire every now and then relating to issues such as immigration, mining efficiency, safaris, etc., in order to improve random flavor at the cost of minor performance and greatly reduced playthrough speeds.

Show options to toggle various features in the mod at the start for an optimal run for the player's preference. The player has §Rone year§! to make their choices, then these decisions will disapper for the rest of the game.
Hide startup options to unclutter the decisions list.
Fires an event to allow the player to decide whether or not they want the USSR event chains to be railroaded towards their historical collapse.
Fires an event to allow the player to decide whether or not they want Superstates to be enabled or disabled for this game.
Fires an event to allow the player to decide whether or not they want Climate Change events and decisions to be enabled or disabled for this game.

Fires an event to allow the player to decide whether or not they want to improve the mod's performance by reducing the world's population to a certain degree. §RWARNING! Any choice made in this event CANNOT be undone, so choose carefully!§!
Display decisions related to military functions.
Collapse the decisions related to military functions in order to declutter the decisions list.
Display decisions related to civil functions.
Collapse the decisions related to civil functions in order to declutter the decisions list.
Display decisions related to economic functions.
Collapse the decisions related to economic functions in order to declutter the decisions list.
Collapse the decisions related to vassals in order to declutter the decisions list.
Display decisions related to international organizations.
Collapse the decisions related to international organizations in order to declutter the decisions list.
